intro: Psychotria cardiomorpha subsp. perpusilla, commonly known as the dwarf heartleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly the islands of Cuba and Hispaniola. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
